meanings.definition: A device used to guide a line or rope in a specific direction.
meanings.sent1: The fairlead on the boat helped keep the rope in place.
meanings.sent2: The fairlead was essential for ensuring the rope stayed on course.
meanings.sent3: The fairlead decided it was tired of always being the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: The fairlead stood tall like a lighthouse, guiding the rope through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The bright red fairlead stood out against the blue ocean, making it easy to spot.

meanings.definition: To guide or direct a line or rope using a fairlead.
meanings.sent1: I will fairlead the rope through the pulley to move the heavy object.
meanings.sent2: She carefully fairleads the line to avoid any obstacles in the water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to fairlead the garden hose around the tree.
meanings.sent4: His words fairlead me through the maze of confusion, helping me find clarity.
meanings.sent5: The skilled sailor fairleads the ropes with precision, maneuvering the sail smoothly.
